result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Court grants Huber and defendant may serve his sentence in a Day Reporting Center.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Samuel L Johnson not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that the defendant serve his sentence in a day reporting center. GRANTED. Court grants Huber.

Defendant Samuel L Johnson in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Samuel L Johnson not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing. Court unable to hear case on this date due to jury trial in session.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Samuel L Johnson not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel L Johnson in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Samuel L Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
